sentences.english: They conversed with the familiarity of a long-established acquaintance.
sentences.chinese: 他們儼然如老相識一樣親密無間地攀談了。

sentences.english: Rich traveler writer is peremptory the newest profession that becomes the United States.
sentences.chinese: 博客作者儼然成爲美國的最新職業。

sentences.english: But they share a charming tenderness. They became the template for all culturally-relevant vampires that followed them.
sentences.chinese: 他們儼然成了之後文化題材中吸血鬼的模板。

sentences.english: When she was dressed to look like, is a lady.
sentences.chinese: 當她裝扮停當趕到時，看上去儼然是一位貴婦人。

sentences.english: In the past few years, some of these monuments have become billboards.
sentences.chinese: 過去的幾年，一些旅遊勝地儼然成爲宣傳的廣告牌。

sentences.english: But it looks stranded in the middle of the market.
sentences.chinese: 但現在的它已儼然退居到中端市場。

sentences.english: Race proved an even more explosive issue.
sentences.chinese: 種族問題儼然更加突出。

sentences.english: Meg enacted escort with great dignity.
sentences.chinese: 梅格儼然扮演着一個護花使者。

sentences.english: He disguised himself as a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 他喬裝改扮，儼然就是一位教書先生。

sentences.english: For collage students, it is encouraging to travel abroad during summer or winder vacation.
sentences.chinese: 大學生利用寒暑假出國遊學儼然形成一種風潮。

sentences.english: This is peremptory each levels that covered a medium and small businesses to manage place to involve.
sentences.chinese: 這儼然涵蓋了一箇中小企業經營所涉及的各個層面。

sentences.english: She’s a national hero in Australia and she’s only 16.
sentences.chinese: 她儼然是澳大利亞的民族英雄，而且她僅有16歲。

sentences.english: From the exterior looks, Yang Jing as if a 10-year-old children.
sentences.chinese: 從外觀看上去，楊靜儼然一個10歲大的兒童。

sentences.english: Students of higher grades acted as guides for the freshmen.
sentences.chinese: 高年級的同學們儼然成爲新生們的嚮導。

sentences.english: The servants were dressed in white with wings on their backs and were to play angels .
sentences.chinese: 僕人們一身皆白，背上有雙翅，儼然天使模樣。

sentences.english: She was proudly modest, like a 26)proper Chinese Child.
sentences.chinese: 她不卑不亢，儼然一個舉止端莊的中國兒童。

definition: not just in name only, but also in reality (idiom)

lit. warp and weft in weaving; vertically and horizontal/length and breadth/criss-crossed/able to move unhindered/abbr. for 合縱連橫|合纵连横[He2 zong4 Lian2 heng2], School of Diplomacy during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
lit. burn your hand, feel the heat (idiom)/fig. arrogance of the powerful/a mighty figure no-one dares approach/hot (exciting or in favor)
to own exclusively/unique to/specific/there is only
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
